abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Economic Reform
            Development Policy Grant Project for Comoros were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was substantial, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            timely capacity assistance through adequate coordination
            with other sector operations and other donors is critical to
            improve governments capacity to implement reforms. Although
            technical assistance is critical to support the
            implementation of reforms, it is not always sufficient for
            entrenching change in national processes. The design of
            reforms must also complement the existing capacities, be of
            relevance from a political economy perspective, and be
            tailored to the existing practicalities. Additional
            consensus may be warranted when implementing reforms that
            touch upon the power sharing between the Island governments
            and the Union. Better understanding should foster trust
            among the parties and help move the agenda forward. Bank
            supervision needs to follow up with the government more
            closely regarding the steps they need to take to achieve the
            indicators supported by the operation.
